inclusion.criterion: Male and female participants between the ages of 5 and 18 years of age.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Has a diagnosis of 'classic' CLN3 disease as determined by age of symptom onset (i.e., 4 to 7 years) and genetic analysis for a defect in the CLN3 (battenin) transmembrane gene at study entry.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Participant must have a mild-to-moderate CLN3 disease documented by the UBDRS.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants are included with a Baseline UBDRS ≤ 15 for Physical Assessment.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participant must be able to independently walk for a distance of at least 20 feet (6 meters).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Participant must be able to tolerate swallowing oral medication or have a gastric/jejunostomy tube for drug administration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants who are of childbearing potential (i.e., have begun menstruation) must have a negative serum pregnancy test at Baseline before receiving PLX-200.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Participants' parents/guardians must agree to comply in good faith with the conditions of the study, including attending all required baseline and follow-up assessments.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants' parents and legal guardians must sign the informed consent form, and participants will provide assent, depending on local regulations and developmental status.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Participant has asymptomatic CLN3 disease, defined as no evidence of neurological signs or symptoms attributed to CLN3 disease such as seizures, ataxia, language delay, or other developmental delays.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Participant has clinically documented generalized motor status epilepticus within 4 weeks of the Baseline visit (treatment may be postponed after discussion with the Medical Monitor until seizures are adequately controlled).
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man who was recently diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. He has mild Hoehn-Yahr Stage I disease and lives with his wife.
